fRss90Cq4aMnFmDOkoDd6A.text: Amazing food and atmosphere! The chef brought our food out which was super nice. The beer selection is great too. I can't wait to go back.

rOgTvFV4ZeHt2xjaFnvYiQ.text: Friendly service.....food was hot and come out quickly with the exception of the pimento cheese fritters. Our server was extremely friendly and made great recommendations. Btw, if you love lemon pepper wings, they have the best in south Charlotte!

vGRvOL4pGiUSl34cOH5KGQ.text: Came in last night to watch the football game on the big screen after work. Sat at the bar and was greeted quickly by the guy bartender. It was pretty late and I wanted a quick bite, looks like most of the staff had left but he said we would be open staying open till the end of the game at least. I figured the kitchen was closed but asked for a sandwich any way and the bartender and manager opened up the kitchen to make me a sandwich. This is the customer service I have been looking for in this area for a long time. This is my 2nd review but Tap Haus 49 is doing what a restaurant should do but often don't. Thank you and keep up the good work !!!

r5Zzd_FhMWIu7ekPRp-FMw.text: Great food,  awesome beer selection that changes frequently to keep you trying new things.   Nice to have something different than the crappy chain restaurants that everyone wants.   Locally owned and operated and love this place

KvayTMPL9PkRnUCK2JsyZA.text: Not sure there is enough difference for the tilted kilt to go back. The menu and atmosphere just does not cut it. Seems to be in a great location but it is never busy.

umJkCzgrAIlsKdRo0Cjjfg.text: I had been wanting to try this place for a while and finally did last night with my family, unfortunately we were underwhelmed! I came to try the lobster hush puppies and pesto pasta. We were seated immediately but that was the only thing that was prompt. We waited over 25 minutes for the appetizer. They no longer serve the pesto pasta so we ordered chicken finger kids meal, blackened shrimp pasta, and the cheesesteak entree. After the appetizer finally came out we waited an additional 20+ minutes for our entrees. My 6 yr. old daughter was starving and complained the entire time as we waited. We could never find our waitress to inquire where our food was and to get more water. This seemed to be the issue with all the surrounding tables as they were looking around as well for their waitresses. When the food finally came, my husband and I were both disappointed. The blackened shrimp pasta lacked seasoning as well as the cheesesteak sandwich, which was also dry and tough. The fries, while a sufficient amount, were cold. The lobster hush puppies could use more lobster and seasoning as well; the honey sauce that comes with is was a nice compliment but overshadowed the actual hush puppy. The portion of the kids meal was good as well as the atmosphere but definitely wasn't worth the $50+.

IjJk_IDbsrCCdZ4aiityMQ.text: This place had plenty of TVs, but the food was just ok. For the portions, it was a bit overpriced. The service was also just ok. They were out of several things on their menu.

k3j6jHvJX-VY6lr7SL54tg.text: Went the other night with a small group. This is getting 5 stars for our waitress Stephanie. She was great!  She has the best personality and clicked with our group perfectly. One of us was very precise on their drink order a d she took it in stride. And he loved his drink. My wings were great. The chicken tenders in Captain Crunch,  not so much. But because Stephanie was so great we didn't care. Go a and see Stefi!!

2H5n8GeZzwD755j90jI1yA.text: Amazing food. Try pimento cheese fritters. BBQ flatbread was amazing.... 5/5 recommend

uyucxAgN8INTJzUwI0YlHg.text: Underwhelming and overpriced. Taking a break after ridding myself of under-cooked chicken wings with horrible "jerk" sauce to write this review. Please be advised of highest prices on house liquor in the area. Service was good. But too many people came over wanting to take away plates while we were still eating. Same owner as the Tilted Kilt that was at this location, with same sorry food and high priced drinks and beer. Lost me again.

s96krZjkCve9Zs_5unj-7w.text: I visited this place on a Wednesday night. It wasn't too crowded. It's a nice spot to unwind and have a drink and dinner. The food was amazing! I will definitely be returning!!

SxwUfJ6HLZEfQm7RXDRnqA.text: Long wait when the place was half empty - they said the kitchen was way behind and needed to stop seating people. Seems they are still working out a few things, but will definitely go back and try again. Food was good - I like the menu.

QwmKWOkfpYYA3zfTcYosvg.text: Great food, good service, reasonably priced with lots of TV's and games (pool, Jenga, darts). Fun place. Interesting menu!

oZt6tVBhhCcJQDsV03mbDg.text: I came here last Friday Night. I live about 5 mins from here, so I was excited to have a new place to check out. A new Restaurant/Bar was definitely needed in this area. When I walked in the Hostess was super nice and friendly, she automatically made me feel welcome. The decor is very nice and relaxing, not to busy. I was waiting for a friend to meet me, so I chose to sit at the bar. The Bartenders Curtis and Rachel were professional and made sure I had what I needed. I tried some fresh cut fries and a Margarita Pizza, it was pretty yummy. To drink I had a local, cider and beer. My first impression was good. I will definitely go back soon!

8NABsyPMpLMnhrTm_hESaQ.text: The food was GREAT!  We had the European and the steak sandwich is was great!   Our server was obviously new to the industry.  She was good and will probably improve with time but she REALLY needs to rethink her stance on calling customers "My Love".  "Can I get your some more tea, My Love?"  "Are these checks together, my Love?"  "What can get for you, my Love?"  Its too familiar and somewhat annoying, but other than that it was a great experience.

QgGVjQ06IndgDdkJUoKAeg.text: Food might have been good, if we ever had a chance to try our entrees.  Our server was attentive and friendly - she brought us our beverages, apps (amazing hush puppies!), and kids meals (thank goodness!)  We then proceeded to wait about 45 minutes only to have our server return to tell us that the kitchen lost our ticket, and it would be another 30 minutes.  Since we'd already been there over an hour with 2 young children, we cut our losses and left.  The manager took $20 off our bill, though we still left hungry and disappointed.  Service team seemed disorganized on a somewhat crowded Saturday night.  Would like to return and try the food... maybe we should try a weeknight dinner instead. :/

GAD15zKMoO4DP2ysGT3NQQ.text: Everything about this restaurant is great! Beautifully decorated, great service, lots of tvs, games, loved the food and cocktails!! It's a breath of fresh air! Try the pimento cheese fritters, flatbread, and I love the rise up for a cocktail!! So many choices, definitely needed this in the neighborhood !! Oh and the warm brownie with ice cream is to die for!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States

j6JNYs3B_nbV-KGQBSEXTw.text: Enjoyed the first weekend of Brunch. The service was spot on. Nice vibe, very busy. Had crab eggs Benedict , delicious. Going back next weekend for chicken and waffles. Perfect brunch menu! Love this restaurant. It's a much go and enjoy the great food and service!! Thanks Taphaus 49!

9wSshVV81jiN1CpEAiB_Pw.text: I gave three stars because the food was good. We went at an off peak time and the service was very slow. They got all of our orders incorrect as well. The atmosphere was good. I wouldn't recommend going at a busy time. We also saw other people sending their order back.

BG0m_P2zij3MglMXiauwhw.text: TapHaus 49 has it all, atmosphere, great service and amazing food. It offers a wide variety of craft beer and tasty libations. It's a great place for the entire family. The fresh menu offers a new take on pub food while keeping it simple and unique. The sweet & spicy lobster filled hushpuppies are amazing. TVs everywhere as well as ping pong, jenga and darts.

8lH43mCW3q1WKIu_vZcdow.text: Great food and staff. Went twice in a row. Once for a business dinner and then again the next day for just something to eat. This place is becoming popular.

aj5wSgfz1emdsauYFxtJmA.text: Great atmosphere and good food. Staff was very friendly and the manager Steven came by to make sure we were being well taken of. The flatbreads and brussel sprouts (normally not a big fan of brussel sprouts) were delicious. Excited they will be offering brunch soon.

VOE0bxhhfTafFl_sjFUVJQ.text: Looking for a place to try, and decided to check this place out. The food was pretty good (portobello sandwich was to die for!) and our server, Zaimarie, was on top of it and SO NICE! Clean atmosphere, nice service, decent prices, good food! Much better than the restaurant that used to be here---Tilted Kilt. Good place to come for bar food and some football, also family friendly. Will be back!

qMn3ukcwZ62TDRvaHkTSBA.text: We've been twice in the last month and both times we were super impressed. Our servers were so friendly, professional, and accommodating. We liked how everyone seemed to be helping each other out. Manager and other servers running food, etc. Food was great, Panang egg, pretzels with beer cheese, chicken, crispy Brussels, sesame green beans, flatbread. Everything came out perfect. Fries weren't my favorite, but I'm a fry snob and prefer fresh cut over thin and crispy. Love that they have games for the kids or adults to play with, big jenga, connect four, and a pool table. Nice to let the kids play while we could hang out. AND they do coupons, which we love! We'll definitely be going back!

Icesqp7t5L-S5IOPwqZ_kg.text: Our service was less than stellar. We had to go retrieve a manager after waiting for our server to come back for over 20 minutes. She took our drink and appetizer order and never returned. Two different servers brought us our drinks and our appetizer. After the manager took the order for our entrees and got me a new beer (my original glass had a huge chip in it), we saw our server once more during our dinner. Our food was good, but I can make good food at home, I go out to eat to not have to worry about things like this. The manager never came back to make sure we got everything sorted out. The restaurant was not busy, it was a Thursday night, but by the way the (over staffed) restaurant was acting, you'd think it was an overpacked Friday. We were excited for the prospect of a locally owned restaurant, but it doesn't live up to the hype. It seems like the restaurant isn't too concerned about disappointed customers, so we'll be taking our business elsewhere.   Also, don't be fooled by some of the reviews on Yelp and Facebook by people who work at this restaurant. Don't be surprised if you see some familiar faces when you stop in!

H-or4q-byvRPtbPNypm0IQ.text: AMAZING food! So refreshing for Steele Creek! Pimento Cheese Fritters with the pineapple haberno dipping sauce is addictive! The wings are some of the best I've ever had! Lobster hush puppies are also incredible! Great service, delicious cocktails and great beer selection, and a fun bar atmosphere with classic games like pool, corn hole, darts, giant Jenga, & more plus TONS of TVs- so great for Panthers game! Couldn't ask for more!

je5e3HHWzcKRgbYlfvOZOg.text: We went in because it was down the street from my house and it was still open. Exceeded my expectations! Everything was delicious! Definitely reformed it the staff was very friendly!

0VECEctVpD_yTcWzAu93Rg.text: Nice atmosphere, good food, friendly staff.  Only complaint would be the limited beer offering.  They def need to expand their bottle list.  the only craft options are on tap; bottled ones are big brand like mich and bud.  And not a single stout or porter on tap - in NOV?!  Def be back though.  Assuming they'll fix this.

64eOCxWjySR8QAtaC1ZFXw.text: I live in the area and am glad something new has gone in this location.  The atmosphere is good, lots of games on the many TVs on a Saturday afternoon.  The mixed drinks were excellent and the food was very good.  This was only the second weekend they were open and the weekend before was the hurricane weekend.  The service was slow, one of the owners came out and talked to us, said their chef was out that weekend.  The place was pretty full and the kitchen was behind.  But the owner apologized and gave me a free drink.  I'm really hoping this place works the kinks out quickly.  We need this in our area and the food (& drinks) were really good.  We will be back, hoping the service has gotten it together.

Qy7EeTZCy48ZEwBXEVw0pQ.text: The service is very attentive and when I told the server I was vegan, she helped me select my choices. Then, the chef came out to offer to make me a special vegan sauce because the one for my pasta had cheese in it. Restaurants never ever do that for dietary restrictions so I really appreciate the personal touch that the chef provided. The food was a bit salty but nonetheless, the service and positive chef experience made it all worth it!

hIZpgagZ2HsPzBVeTQCAFg.text: Atmosphere, great staff, superior selections!  Love this for a lunch spot, or dinner out with friends.

dLzfPa-g7UlYmUnrVjq5_Q.text: I work nearby and was very excited to see the Tilted Kilt finally replaced by something that looked promising.  The good: big location, pool table & some games. Brighter interior than previously. The bartender was excellent. A very good craft beer list. Not too big, but a well round selection of locals.  The bad: the food.  All of it.  1st I order the Margarita flatbread. What came out was a floppy, completely over sauced thing.  Each square has a thick slice of beefsteak tomato & a glob of mozzarella on it. Give that a sprinkling of dried basil. To make it seem wood fired I guess they grilled the flatbread which just made it taste burnt on the grill marks.  I sent it back.  Next, the burger: nothing special about it. It was eatable though and I was starving. Over cooked (I asked for medium) greasy, and nothing special.  I look at the menu & it's just all over the place. That tells me everything is frozen & just plopped in fryers &/or the grills.  It's plain boring generic food.     I wanted to be excited for this place, but I won't be back unless I stop for a beer to wait out traffic on the way home and to better places.

AzDhWZjgz1gAn6XipNtDyw.text: We finally tried TapHaus49 tonight and it DID NOT DISAPPOINT!! They had one of our favorite beers on tap!  The wait staff was incredibly friendly, attentive and knowledgeable. The service was fast and the food was very tasty. We shared the pretzels with beer cheese and stone ground mustard as an appetizer. AMAZING. I had the turkey and Brie panini. AMAZING. My boyfriend had the European burger. AMAZING. We shared a side of the crispy Brussels sprouts. AMAZING.  Are you seeing the trend here? For desert we shared the fried Oreos. You guessed it... AMAZING!! We will definitely be back!! I hope this place is here forever!!

w5dZZohtOLlFPZBQ7iEJjg.text: In town visiting family in the Charlotte area. I had the lobster hush puppies and they were literally all breading and not really worth it. I also ordered some bourbon maple wings and as I was about to bite into one of my wings ... I found a hair. I told my server and her response was simply ..."Ok". And I heard nothing from the server or the manager. I then addressed the server due to the lack of response . The manager finally came over and kept asking specifics regarding the hair... not sure why it matters ... specifics ... it was a hair!  I don't see the reason to plant a hair to benefit from $7 wings lol I feel with the constant questioning .. that was the assumption. All and all save your money for a better establishment with better service.

-uuerto_FoGyV7k1P8LN1A.text: Arrived and there was no host at the front door, waited for about 5-7 minutes and then proceeded to walk towards the restaurant/bar area in hope of having some acknowledge that we were waiting. At no point did any server or bartender attempt to greet or acknowledge us. I understand this is a new establishment, however it was not extremely busy and someone should have taken note that there were patrons waiting. The menu and decor both seemed great. However, the service in my experience left a lot to be desired.

yEIUU2vozJ-g47rBraeTsQ.text: I thought I'd give this a try since it is "hot and new" but I think because of Shelby having a bad day I may stick to others in the area.  Very accommodating to put the Bears game on but aside from that, tremendously average.  I should've asked to change servers so it wouldn't put a damper on things but the spicy chicken sandwich was dry and the portion of beer cheese was too small.  Maybe I will give TH49 some time and try again in a few months.   Shelby, please take notes on how the other servers interacted with their customers and I promise you will make more in tips!

RanbiWyrbN52E7kAFvf91g.text: Brand new restaurant. We really like it. Nice layout. You'll find some menu items here that are a little different like a salami spring roll and pork belly flatbread. The staff was great. They're was some awkwardness as they're still learning to work together but overall, it was a great experience.

lgT5-EmIJe2BJmZ1m9CY6A.text: Updated review. Horrible. Horrible service at the bar where one would think it should be good. Let's start by saying the name first of all does not match the menu. Haus is a german name for old house. There is nothing german on this menu. The bartenders eat behind the bar while flirting with married men and the manager disappears. This is on a random Wednesday evening. You have failed before and are an epic failure... again.

zyfuL1f2Q4noEcPqn-CuPg.text: Great new spot in town!  Love the open spaces, bar and sit down area, big TVs and happy staff!  Try the fried green tomatoes. Done right!  Burger and chicken sandwich were perfect. Fun craft beers on tap. Great new spot in Steele creek!

oEMpeeTCfLridrl-RxOCnQ.text: Had dinner tonight. Flat bread was very good. Charcuterie board was a joke. Decent place that still has a ghetto feel like the Tilted Kilt. Not sure I will return.

Y-aK7yptFA7ngY_-kb4c_A.text: Welcome to the neighborhood TapHaus49! Great beer selection and t v's everywhere you look. The best part of this place is the great menu that is so diverse. Not standard sports bar food, I will be back often

uxlT_p9nQvMdBi8nVLbMkg.text: Fun atmosphere, low selection on the beers and my kiddo and I did not care for our food. (He had the kids pizza and I had a bizarre spring roll appetizer.)  I don't plan on visiting again.

xwkeQe194NJ_Piy5vOpFTw.text: My family enjoyed brunch here this morning and it was FANTASTIC! Prices are reasonable, food was delicious, and service was great. My husband had the chicken and waffles and he said the sriracha syrup was on point. I had the CYO omelet and it was fluffy and delicious! My son had the egg and cheese sandwich with bacon and cheese grits and it was such a huge portion we had to take half of the sandwich home. He is 11 and usually a bottomless pit, so that says a lot about the portion size. My youngest had the kids waffles and fruit cup and cleaned her plate. This is a newer restaurant so not many people know about it or their yummy brunch on the weekends. I definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a bite to eat in the Steele Creek area.

_GhCCWu-k50bfdHHZcZt4g.text: The food here is amazing. The variety of wing flavors is good, the burgers are huge, even the kids burger. The European burger is probably my favorite. Make sure to get the pretzel appetizer, three come out and it is great to share. Sometimes service can be slow, but the servers are nice and the food is worth it.

4Dk25ahIKoSdGt8rQ5PbWw.text: First visit tonight.....start off with very nice place, and very good service -Lobster/ jalapeno hush puppies were great - blue burger, chicken club, salmon were all really good and cooked perfectly... sides were amazing.....jalapeno sweet potato's.....balsamic brussel sprouts also...  a bit pricey.....but not terrible app was $9 ( pricey for what you got) burgers $11 ( spot on, fair price) salmon $17 (a bit pricey for size) food score was 92....so room for improvement.

3HmshHbhqiNv_veE-GCU1w.text: We've been here 2x for brunch and cant wait to try dinner. Excellent food and service. Staff and management go out of their way to make sure you're taken care of. Today my 9 year son who is obsessed with luxury sports car, saw a Farrari parked in the parking lot at the restaurant. He took a picture of it and the staff took notice. At the end of our meal the owner of the Farrari (and restaurant) took my son out to the car, let him sit in it and rev it up. It made his day!

photos.caption: Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taup Haus 49

XYzYhJ_sXgIOTL9pueH4DQ.text: I am super excited I found this hidden gem in Steele Creek. Nice family oriented space and the food is superb. The menu has normal sport bar food but taken it up 10 times. Just had their lobster hush puppies and they were mouth watering. Love that we know have a great local food spot with an outstanding menu.

qWt-gDUqA98lc8EQFHI95w.text: I'm glad to see this type of restaurant in Steele Creek area. Service was good and I like the open atmosphere.  My wife and I ordered the following:  APPS:  Lobster hush puppies: 4 pups. Loved them.   Tuna tacos: good but only three to share? Should make it 4. Also minced garlic is too much. Took away from the other flavors  MEAL:  Hot chicken sandwich: it was dry and the fries were cold. Had to return it. The next batch was much better and the piece of chicken was bigger. However, the fries were really salty. We had to knock off the salt.   Blue foot burger:  overall the burger was ok. The angus burger itself had no taste. The sweet potatoes had sweet sauce that was too much sweetness.   So the experience was ok. It would have been nice to comp the hot chicken but they didn't. The manager didn't even check on us.  There were only 5 tables seated.   If you are looking for a similar place with better quality food, I would suggest Coppers Pub a few miles down the road.

Jpq73oOiJs4oZmD7r-Zk4g.text: Horrible food and lack luster service.  Delays on items and just overall garbage.. will never come back here again!

UEZvTUfqFxy8hTstieWdtA.text: Last week we had a group of 5 for lunch and it was an employees birthday, we had Karen as a server, she was great, we ordered some different things, the Calamari was killer as was the flatbreads, the fries were addictive. Thank you for the complimentary birthday brownies and ice cream. Finally a local restaurant that is not bar food and sports.

mSE3cIh56iBkD5rohCNS0A.text: Meh. That sums this place up.  They took a bunch of time renovating it from when it was Tilted Kilt and the decor and atmosphere is decent, the food is alright too but the service is always terrible.  Every server we've had acts confused and our order has never been completely right.  The beer selection is decent and it's never super crowded, it's around the corner from my house so it's an ok choice if you can't think of any other options.

9F7lzVn6dCP-H8kDHPzL7Q.text: The food sounded good but was kind of sub par. We had pretzels, sticky buns, Fig and prosciutto flatbread and the wonton tacos. Really the flat bread was the best but still just ok. Wouldn't go back especially for the price.

-V2rPff3NPkXCrjj9zR5sA.text: Our first visit will surely not be our last. TapHaus49 has a great atmosphere and interior design. The service was quick and attentive. And the food was great! They rotating taps to include local breweries and ciders. Gary, one of the owners, greeted us at our table and had a nice conversation - nice local family run restaurant.

WCbY4dbPJGkZSS4GIKcvEA.text: I agree with another post that said comments are either coming from restaurant staff or individuals with very low expectations of a restaurant.  Wife and I stopped in this past Saturday, since we live very close.  Decor (exterior and interior) and concept is an improvement from Tilted Kilt.  We certainly welcome a restaurant whose central theme is not young girls with push-up bras.  The food is very average.  Wife had a chicken sandwich, while I had one of their burgers.  We waited an extraordinary long time for a very simple meal at a time when there were few customers.  Wife ordered Brussel sprouts as a side, but her meal came with fries instead. Waitress realized the mistake and brought us two sides for the error. Appears this is primarily a beer joint with food being a secondary item.  They will certainly get traffic during football season, but the real test will be surviving afterwards.  We do want the restaurant to survive for the sake of neighborhood appeal, but I suspect it will experience the same demise as the other 2 restaurants in the same location unless there is an improvement in the food.  I will drive to Hickory Tavern rather than taking another chance here.  Lastly, found it interesting that my credit card charge read Tilted Kilt.

xOQjtAEEiXxcz3THeEyptg.text: Excellent Restaurant  Had brunch today at TapHaus on Carowinds Blvd. This is one eatery that I have to highly recommend. First, the food is very good. The eggs Benedict was the best that I have ever had. My wife and daughter and I enjoyed our meals very much. Next, the service was exceptional, from the greeting by the co-owner to the service by the staff. The care by the staff was exceptional and friendly. This restaurant is one of the few that has good coffee. The owner told me that the coffee is their own. The company is located on Staten Island, New York, ant the coffee is roasted and blended to their specification, and the quality shows.  The TapHaus serves brunch on Saturday and Sunday from 10:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m., and the menu serves both meals. An adult drink menu is available if you so desire.  For a great way to start your weekend, I highly recommend the TapHaus.

TCbJnuXqq01RvSMXCOzJ3w.text: Came here for drinks. Good craft beers, service could be slightly faster considering there weren't many people there. A friend of mine had the fish tuna tacos and said they were great. Will go back to try the food.

qmvTc0Xwi2K2vU6N-3668Q.text: Burgers better, skinny fries now better seasoned and wings hit the mark.  Much improved and so glad they got rid of the pool table, just because people let kids throw the balls ...so good call on improving the place.  Good service, great TV presentation.

mBh1D63AniWDrtadG0BpUw.text: Arrived around 8:30 and were told it would be a 15 minute wait with a lot of open tables. That should have been the first sign. We were seated in about 10 minutes, however. Food was regular standard fare bar food but ended up with an $80 bill. I had the chicken sandwich and didn't finish it, which is unusual. Kids had the pepperoni pizza and it looked like microwave pizza when it arrived, and it looked like they took a small pizza, cut it in half and gave each kid a half. We are taking this one off the rotation.

UGm2NGoINjO-GSl9l913SQ.text: Just got a multiple item takeout order. Not sure if it's right or not yet but it doesn't matter. The hostess tonite was super friendly and deserves a raise. I think someone was teasing her while there so I felt bad for laughing. Called back to apologize but no one answered hahahahaha 5 Stars basically.

JyjbiODZv0NBxZ5s-p8UiQ.text: After all of the hoopla on Nextdoor, we decided to visit. Not for sober patrons. Food not that great.

Uxlf4FBskCUG5NqxMUAVZg.text: there are 49 reasons to give this place a 4 out of 5 rating. just kidding, I won't put you through that. turkey panini was great, good beer selection - only criticism is that no TapHaus should have bud light on draught...

FNB2Tb4JLO6z_GSk8v0sqA.text: Just in town for the night and wanted someplace close. This was a great choice. Fairly new, still perfecting some menu items so they were not available.  We ordered the wings, crunchy skin, juicy meat, not over fried. Pimento cheese fritter balls were good, came with pineapple habanero jam that was awesome, would also make a great wing sauce. Pork belly Mac (n cheese). Covered w/too much hoisen, masked flavor of slightly over cooked pork belly, needs more cheese. Honey jalapeno sweet potatoes, good, nice n sweet with cinnamon, couldn't find any jalapeno flavor. They were really good with the left over jam mixed in.

sWcZJQoAHgS_gNX1kH3BIg.text: My homegirl and I came here around the time they first opened and we both enjoyed it and see so much potential in this spot! Their food was very good, I got one of the salads and the pretzel is to die for! I will definitely be back for an updated review very soon!

4m8rlQSZ_kgbwaExKILbjQ.text: This place used to be the old Tilted Kilt. They have a pool table, darts, life sized Jenga, and connect four. The food was good, Lobster Hush puppies were on point! Probably my favorite I've had on the menu. Garlic fries were delicious and although the I didn't have the wings they looked really good! My girlfriend said they were delicious. I had a chicken sandwich and I was a tad bit disappointed it was just over cooked and dry I'd imagine that it wasn't over cooked it would be really good. All in all I'd come back

photos.caption: Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bourbon Maple wings
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Sandwich with sweet potato side
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Hush puppies were Bangin!

-3VKzHm1oMzjW-ulanrTGQ.text: From the moment that we walked into Tap Haus 49 we were immersed in a sense of wholesomeness and welcoming ambiance. We were completely unprepared for meeting our waitress Tyra for her unbelievable and incredibly rare passion and flare for people. Throughout the entire experience she never wavered from this sense of being and she had such an effortless ability to give the best of best customer service, accommodating and exceeding each and every expectation or need that a patron could ever need when dining. Her charisma and impeccable capability's were wonderfully paired with the other staffing as they worked together as a team with a clearly like mindset of delivering the best service experience possible to their customers that they never hesitated to lend an extra hand to one another, not to mention with such efficiency and finesse. As if that were not enough we were blessed enough to have arrived on a night that they were hosting a live jazz musician that sent the experience and ambiance to the next level. Most importantly when it came time for the food to arrive we could not believe the artisanal quality and uniquely beautiful pairings of flavors. We started with an appetizer of seasonal humus and pimento cheese fritter with an amazing pineapple-habanero jam. The Humus was of plentiful quantity without worry of running out of the soft  grilled pita and the pimento fritters were so fresh and sensational that they simply just melted in your mouth with an explosion of taste and sensations. When the main course came it was presented in such a way that we were simply in awe. The salmon was uniquely presented on freshly charred cedar plank that description could never fully describe the spectrum of flavor and never have I had such a freshly made, well constructed meatless burger - the clean eater. Even the attention to the smallest of details as adding a lemon and oregano seasoning to the fries continued to add to the vast palate that they offered. So often we get lost in the everyday experience of the one size fits all dinning experience that the industry has forgotten or lost it's flare for the luxury that is dinning out. What Tap Haus 49 has done is create an atmospheric experience with impeccable ambiance, favorable artisan quality food, incomparable service, and at a reasonably affordable price range. This is an experience that I look forward to visiting again and again especially with Tyra, anytime and whenever we are visiting the area. We without hesitation offer our recommendation to those looking to truly experience dining out as it should always be.

_LtI7bV6f104rKgPL9a5mg.text: Not sure what happened to the old Tilted Kilt... again, but now it's TapHaus 49. I guess the craft beer bandwagon is still going strong. In all honesty, the decor is much, much better than the previous theme. It also feels much cleaner and welcoming.  it's still a generic sports bar with a visual and auditory assault of whatever Trogolite vs Neanderthal event is going on at the time. The layout of the entire place is nearly identical as before, so the familiarity was welcoming.  They have a respectable selection of craft beer, so we sat down and ordered our beers. I ordered a lager and the barely-legal bartender places in front of me a jet-black (albeit beautiful) pint of beer. I asked her if she poured the right thing as lagers are typically yellow in color. She looked back at the tab and apologize as they'd kicked the beer I wanted and she didn't realize it. No biggie, I kept the beer and still enjoyed it.  We had a couple more beers, the girls came over to have a small casual convo with us. All pretty standard, uneventful stuff. It was a pleasant visit and when I'm in the area, I will visit again... but not make a special trip just to visit.

KiIjfRHIFrrmgeN65zx6aQ.text: The lady that served us was really nice. That's about all the good things I have to say. Had to ask multiple times for water was the was the soup available. Took extremely long for the food. The food was good. Will probably never go back. And I get asked a lot about restaurants good or bad I will not be able to say anything good about this place. The funniest part was the lady said she try the avocado toast. Your plate comes with four pieces ours came with three. Wonder where she got the taster piece.

axoCB9C8nlzHsun55dULyw.text: A huge restaurant. The only deduct was the cheesy bar decor inside. Had the European Burger with broccolini. Burger was cooked a perfect medium-rare super juicy on a great brioche bun. Broccolini was delicious as well. Decent beer list.

E09ZKQSGLU0Pm_Nfvw4iyg.text: Came here to watch the Wimbledon men's final and have a beer. Almost nobody here (far more workers than customers) and they're blasting country music. Unless that's the demographic they're going for (on a Sunday at noon- good luck with that in Steele Creek!), they will continue to have wait staff hanging out with nothing to do as is the case here now.

XLbnCHotagP7_q30BouubA.text: Great New place in the area. Fun menu and good prices. Nice beer selection with local craft brews and national brands. Tons of TV's for sporting events and lots of seating for lunch, dinner, business meetings etc. Noise level is great for conversation. Not loud like other places. Gary the owner is very warm and friendly. Make the trip out. You will be glad you did.

photos.caption: Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States

-1oBkKiXOwx83SsxNex-bw.text: Not coming back worst customer service ever. Our service was on SOME DRUG. She was extremely rude when asked a question she was rude ever single time at the end she play the pitty party that we are nice so we could tip her. We always pass by and never went it WE GAVE IT A SHOT AND NEVER COMING AGAIN

pt3JwOUViGmz6fnOm5XKyA.text: Delicious burger, love the mix of brisket-beef-short rib in the patty.  The lemon-oregano fries (shoestring) are absolutely amazing.  Good beer selection, helpful staff and good vibe.  Added bonus, restrooms are spotless!  My wife also had a dairy allergy and they were very accommodating.

BYhT-VwhxT15FeIWaIRgHQ.text: Finally made it here for the first time and it did not disappoint. Food was cooked perfectly, flavors were excellent, staff was attentive and friendly, and owner was so polite and welcomed us warmly!   We had wonton tacos, lobster hush puppies, calamari, caprese salad, blackened shrimp pasta, prosciutto flatbread, and a burger... can't remember which one, my father in law ordered... and he is very picky and travels all around. He adored the fries here, so much so he mentioned it about six times!   Definitely check this place out!   Oh - we also had the brownie dessert, OMG perfect!!   Thank you

cH0F_sChB_lhFHVOBFat5Q.text: Real deserves zero 0! Went on 5/26 only 14 people in the place. So no excuse for slow and incorrect order! Started with asked for water no ice. Got iced water and then server disappeared for 14 minutes ordered the Europen burger with gluten free bread, and 2 other orders. Advised no issue with getting gluten free bread. Order took 41 minutes to arrive...yes we were starving. Order arrives and server advises that its on regular bun  from kitchen and i can just not eat the bread. I advised if she's aware that it you ask for gluten free they cannot just come back with regular buns...as someone can have an adverse reaction....she said she know and just leaves. . I took off the bread. Two minutes later she comes with "gluten free bread".. She blamed everything on the kitchen...there were only patrons at the bar. Then she disappears again.  We had to go to bar to ask for bill...then she walksin. The other 2 ordets were also sub par.  I have only given 1 other bad review. Tap Haus 49 experience was horrible.on service and especially food.  No concern for customer.

mmsp005Kq6wM5lQBrq_i_A.text: Met some friends out for dinner and had fairly mediocre expectations before arriving. Just walking up to the front door, I was happy with the aesthetic of the place. Inside the placement of the bar, and tables was impressive as well.  We sat outside on the covered patio with good views of multiple TVs.  The food was priced fairly and I felt that my spend was well worth it after splitting the burger with my wife, there was plenty to eat. The cook on the patty was as requested - medium. The taste and quality exceeded expectations and I can easily say that I look forward to returning!  Stop in and grab a bite, I think you'll be pleased.

rd4JHq_rZSVPtbFu5pO7JQ.text: What can I say regarding this amazing restaurant that hasn't been said before,the service was excellent, I always said no matter how good the meal is, if the service lacking then the experience is spoiled, but not here at the TapHaus49. The staff did a fantastic job in making sure that the customers are attended to. The cuisine is one of kind, it's superb and outstanding. I had the shrimp and pasta and my partner had the steak and potatoes. Incredible experience! Will definitely go back.

Y1kPSqrbMarQnqnfoBfqCg.text: Stopped by for a late meal. Service was exceptional (Olivia), restaurant was clean, food was very good, nice portions, really good flavor. The pasta was cooked perfectly and spiced well.beer was cold! We'll go back.

jsDYDmFkTrcJsaDjnpkhuw.text: We ordered the following: Lobster hushpuppies- they were ok Tuna Wonton tacos- they were good Small Haus Salad with the house dressing was really good. Small Caesar Salad- the romaine was old and brown. We sent it back to get another one Pomegranate Cosmo- was ok   The service was really good our server was Asheme.  The people beside us were pretty intoxicated and all the servers & the manager were taking care of them!   The manager tried to come over & apologize for the salad but it was clear that the kitchen staff could careless about what they serve paying customers.

mtU5ibIxylDfddFnHR2yRQ.text: Live nearby and my wife and I wanted to try a new place on our anniversary. We have seen past establishments  on this spot fail.  GLAD WE ENTERED.  The place now has LIFE!  Lights everywhere, TVs from every corner.  Super inviting.  We decided to order the House Burger with fries and sweet potatoes on the side.  ANOTHER HOME RUN!   Drinks were also great.  Steven, the owners brother walked around asking customers if all was great and making everyone "feel at home".  The waitress always attentive.  As we left the manager also asked if all was great.  I drive by the place everyday and now seems it's always full !!  Why?  GREAT SERVICE, GREAT FOOD, GREAT ATMOSPHERE AND GREAT MANAGEMENT!  Highly recommend!!!

photos.caption: Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hous Burger,  fries and sweet potatoes

tpqjBVrCdCzyG5h3CLU1GA.text: Amazing ! Andrew IS THE MAN ! It Was My First Time Coming And Its So Nice Outside And It. I Got The Haus49 Burger And The Beer Belly Mac. And The Mac Was BUSSSINNNNN !!! Ill Definitely Come Back And Bring A Group With Me Next Time !

YI0H7942zu_5GmsZx2Oq6w.text: Me and my boss frequent this place weekly. We always have the same server, and it seems like the owner greets you when you walk in, which is phenomenal when you visit so much.  I will say this. The first month or so when they opened the food was brought out wrong. It was undercooked, or the wrong sides.   The reason I give it 5 stars, is the owner will immediately come see you and rectify any wrong doings. The servers are amazing, and they will do whatever it takes to make you happy.  I can say this. Their steak salad is to die for. Cooked perfectly. Steak is hot and salad is ice cold.   It's a awesome atmosphere, with great sections and great food. If nothing else, I've never been to a restaurant where the owners and managers have such care for food and service. I still go there once a week.   I'll keep going back, and so should you.

MnxzWFQfB-j_FGORuUpCSQ.text: Came in after a trip to Carowinds. The food is amazing. Highly recommend the fig and prosciutto flatbread and the hot chicken sandwich. Amazing quality for the price.  The service was fabulous.  Can't wait to come back next summer!

SpidgWk65353hklDW6cS2A.text: Food was just ok, nothing memorable . Wait for table, long wait for food despite restaurant being less than half full. Best I can say was staff were friendly, but we had to repeatedly get their attention for refills or order food . I don't like to post negative reviews but this is not an establishment I would visit again.

f0_j5Y6vWiKC2KOWQSf_ow.text: The food and beer was good. Service was attentive and pleasant. I was expecting more beer on tap though. My burger was well prepared and built with love. I tried two (or three ;-)) different beers, but nothing really caught my eye. I would come back, maybe next time I'll sit on the patio.

_Xky99mDL4U_GdGMGJwV5g.text: After Tilted Kilt made two tries here, this location is now TapHaus. The food seems similar and the waitresses are completely covered and I'm perfectly okay with that.  Bar food and lots of televisions are the order of the day now, though there are a few things that are unusual. Sauteed mussels and lobster hushpuppies and a bone-in pork chop, for instance. And then salads and burgers and mac & cheese and flatbreads. All looking good, with a beer list just as long.  Meeting a friend for lunch and not drinking beer as it's a work day, I went to the "Blue Foot" burger, bunless. This is a short rib and brisket beef blend with mushrooms and blue cheese and arugula. Quite tasty and I subbed out the "lemon oregano fries" for an order of broccolini.  I'm a fan. I wish this place success!  [Review 10198 overall, 1784 of 2018.]

photos.caption: Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. TapHaus49, Charlotte
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger WITH bun at TapHaus49
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger without bun at TapHaus49

c96iwL60kODDhf3x1BL1DQ.text: My husband and I ate here for the first time last night. The food was absolutely delicious and the service by Apryl was outstanding! We haven't had service that good in quite awhile. Thank you Apryl! She made sure to educate us on the menu and beer offerings since we were new. We had the pretzel with beer cheese as an app and it was huge but perfect for sharing as we were famished. It came out hot and greasy and actually tasted better than the ones at OMB. They have an excellent variety of craft beer. I enjoyed the Wicked Weed Watermelon and hubs had Legion Juicy J. For dinner, I had the spinach salad with shrimp and it was awesome! Just the right size and very fresh. My husband had the Hot Chicken and devoured it. The large projection screen was great to watch some preseason football. The interior is decorated nicely and is a huge upgrade from the Tilted Kilt. I am so glad we found this amazing place and we can't wait to return!

lbQJ-q0teKRvOSf6wjmmUg.text: This was my first time trying this restaurant. It's fairly new and I was excited to give the menu a shot.   When we arrived the hostess was texting on her phone and made sure to finish what she was doing before acknowledging that we were there. In fact, the other hostess who was cleaning menus saw her on her phone and had to stop what she was doing and greet us. We were seated in the back and it was extremely chilly. There was very cold air blowing onto the tables.   We ordered our food and I got the fig and prosciutto flatbread and we split the lobster hush puppies as an appetizer. The hush puppies were good. The sauce they come in is like a mildly spicy honey mixture. It comes with 5 pups. The flatbread came out looking lovely. I asked for my prosciutto extra crispy, which it was not, but still tasted good. I love the idea of the flatbread. The flavors are great together and the bread was very crisp and delicious. The only issue was there was WAY too much fig on it. It was overwhelmingly sweet, even for me and I'm a sweet fan. I had to scrape most of it off and put my toppings back on. It even made the bread a little soggy after sitting.   My friend ordered fries that I tasted and they were awful. Rosemary and garlic was on the description, but they were literally bland and plain skinny fries.   The waiter was nice, but extremely slow. He enjoyed spending time chatting with other employees rather than make sure he was serving customers.   Nice atmosphere, drink specials looked good, and live band playing, it does have potential.

photos.caption: Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster hush puppies
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fig and prosciutto flatbread

0w53YZOBpH-40sKKKheLMg.text: I'm going to use an annoying quote that pretty much sums up my whole experience....."It's a no from me dawg."   Sorry, I could resist. I was really looking forward to trying this place. For a Tuesday night they were pretty busy. They had live music and all the TVs on a sports channel.  When I walked in the hostess was texting, she never even looked up at us. So we waited...and finally another sever greeted us and got the hostess's attention so we could be seated.   I decided to go with the Haus burger and garlic and rosemary fries. Meh. The fries were not good. They didn't have any garlic or rosemary flavor. And they arrived cold. When I asked for another order, they were also not flavored and cold. How?   The burger was a little too undercooked for my liking but that's just my personal preference. The service was a bit slow too, we had a hard time trying to get his attention and he didn't come back and check on us until it was time to bring the bill.   Meh. I just wasn't impressed with this place.

photos.caption: Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States

zpaTaxwe07qNmAoUqlX1dg.text: Heading on the way home I just so happen to see this place like hmm never seen that bar before let me try it ! To my surprise they had only been open for a few weeks from what my waitress told me. The staff here are exceptionally friendly. Tap Haus 49 is simply a bar with bar food nothing more nothing less. One thing I can say is apparently the drinks are super strong I ordered the rise up martini and I swear all I tasted was the alcohol for the most part so if you're one for strong drinks then umm yea this is the place to go. I chose an appetizer due to the fact I wasn't really hungry just being greedy I chose the sweet n spicy lobster hush puppies and I must admit they were pretty darn good I couldn't stop swirling my hushpuppies around in the sauce they were drenched in .  I love the fact they have flat screens everywhere even outside on the outside patio. This will be a great neighborhood spot to go and watch the game and have drinks and appetizers with friends .

photos.caption: Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States

MdzUJ5xPlMha-Zy9YpCMrw.text: They just newly opened soo I figure lunch on a Friday would be a good time to go.. Greeted by the manager at the front... And was seated right away. It not that busy which is great.   Ordered the steak sandwich..   3/5: I didn't like the bread that comes with it. It's hard and a lot of it.. But the steak with the cheese and green peppers are nicely done..  4/5: the chicken flatbread. Friend liked it. He didn't complain and ate all of it   Lee our waitress was great. She was knowledge and very attentive.   Would love to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak sandwich.. good but too much bread and bread was tough

Q-BCMi8eiKKDHibEjoH2Nw.text: When I saw this place just recently opened near me and had pretty good reviews, I decided to check it out.   We came here on a game day and there was a pretty good crowd there. They have tons of TVs all over along with pool tables, darts, and some other games. We were seated right away.   We started with an order of the sweet and spicy lobster hush puppies and the pimento cheese fritters. The hush puppies were amazing and the fritters were pretty good too.  For entrees, we wanted to get the banh mi flatbread, but they were out of pork belly which was disappointing. We got the fig and prosciutto flatbread instead along with the hot chicken sandwich and garlic rosemary fries. The flatbread was good, but it was burnt on half of it and the topping portions were off. There was so much fig and balsamic that it was overwhelmingly sweet. The hot chicken sandwich was very disappointing. The piece of chicken was tiny and very dry.   I think this place has a lot of potential, but their food definitely needs some fine tuning. I would definitely give it another chance.   This would be a great place to hang out on game day, but as of right now, I wouldn't seek it out for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot chicken sandwich
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fig and prosciutto flatbread
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimiento cheese fritters

S63Dw894ju_wgWOc0dlJOQ.text: Came for brunch this morning - very good. Super friendly wait staff, good choices, $15 bottomless mimosas. I had the Pork Belly Benedict and it was delicious. Check it out - good to have this place in Steele Creek.

photos.caption: Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork Belly Benedict
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. More TV&#39;s
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fresh burger - veggie - tasty!

z9NFcbBcIvW49bI1Kv41pw.text: Went in and sat for a good 15 minutes no service whatsoever. We eventually got up and left.

cWQ1j9bzPPcKgZ2ofCnVpg.text: Thought I was bringing my dog.... Which is allowed but came with fiance only.  Burger and fries was amazing.  Great outdoor tables.  Great service.

mNdG1IwznvKZEauGsIPgCg.text: Neat re-do of the old Twin Peaks that failed twice. The staff uses a team approach to waiting tables so the attention is perfect. Your drinks will never go empty.   As the name would imply, the beer selection is excellent and rotates.   I had the hot chicken with no bread. Very tasty and the spice was there. Portion size a bit small. Otherwise delicious.

GsXYm_a8Lo2Vzln1HNstqg.text: Place is pretty cool inside although chairs were a bit uncomfortable. The waiter was nice but super slow! The food was okay not great considering the prices were a bit high for a tap house. We ended up getting wings to start which were pretty good not great but edible. I than ordered the caprese salad took forever to come out which was odd since its just sliced mozzarella, tomato's with vinaigrette drizzled over. Was fresh though. Ordered some Pinot Grigio wasn't the best Our bill was $130 which I wasn't anticipating but I didn't feel we really ordered too much or drank too much for that type of bill. We went there on a Friday at 5:30 because we were hitting up Carowinds right after and its right down the street. Locations easy to find. All in all its okay I would go back but only if I was in the neighborhood and starving.

fJdGViQXKjpnqMhNw4_J1A.text: Service was decent. The veggie burger was very sweet, which was odd, I wasn't able to finish it due to the overwhelming sweetness.  Food was mediocre, overall.

8wsbYIifwFRuvKl60D-wfA.text: What a vast improvement from tilted kilt! Actually proud to have this in my neighborhood! The food, service and atmosphere is great! Leigh was my server and she was fantastic! I had the salmon and it was excellent! I recommend the Brussels sprouts too! Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon. Brussels. Rice.

yzTxjGJ8w3lFn2UsBctaSQ.text: I really want to like this place because we need this in the Steele Creek area. The place has a lot of potential, but it's not there yet. To be fair, I think this was their first full week of operation. And one thing that made up for most of my disappointments was that one of the owners stopped by our table to talk to us (unsolicited). He asked us how it was and listened attentively as we told him areas they needed to improve. Then he comp'ed a drink for us.   Areas they did really good on:                 -The food was excellent. I had the Hot Chicken sandwich with Brussel Sprouts side. This was amazing. My wife had the wings and garlic fries. Very good.                 -They had a pretty nice selection of local craft beer, including about 8 IPA's. Very nice.                 -They had lots of football games on, with big screen TV's   Let's look at the areas they missed:                 -Service was slow. The wait staff seemed confused about where the tables were. We sat for about 15 minutes before a waitress came by and asked, have you been waited on? Nope...She was very nice and apologetic and did a good job thereafter.                 -The kitchen was very slow. The owner said he chef was out this week, maybe that explained part of it. But we waited a long time for our food.                 -The place seems unusually loud. I had the same experience in this building years ago when I came under a different restaurant.                 -They served by really nice Local Craft IPA in the Bud Light glass-the horror! I tried to turn the label away so I couldn't see it, but I think it still impacted by enjoyment of my beer. J   Overall, I give them a 3 star, with high hopes for the future.

5Gq_wW53VgESxWyQIgBDKw.text: Nice venue, with an open floor plan that would fit a good bit of folks in a busy night.  Clean restrooms also, which is a always a plus!   I stopped by for a quick lunch on the way to an event, so I just ordered an app as my meal.  The first thing I noticed was how my the bartender placed a napkin down on the bar in front of me as a sort of placemat.  This was such a small, but brilliant gesture.  It definitely gave my little dining space a classy and clean feel.  I went with Panang Egg app for my meal.  I was curious to see how this (not very Asian themed) venue would present a curry.  I was pleasantly surprised!!  The two generous slabs of pork belly perfectly complemented the sweet fried/tempura egg that sat on top of a beautiful bed of jasmine rice.  The curry was my favorite part.  With the sweet tempura egg and salty juicy pork belly, the light spicy coconut was all I needed.  The app was hearty enough to fill me up and the dish was so perfectly balanced flavor-wise.  The Spirit Away was alright.  Casamigos is one of my fave tequilas, so already, the cocktail was set up for success with this liquor as its base.  However, part of what drew me in was the muddled blackberries in the drink, and unfortunately the bar didn't have the actual fruit.  Also, the basil was served as a garnish, when I was hoping it would've maybe been muddled in for flavor.  Overall, my experience was a really good one, and next time I'm on this side of town, I just might drop back in!

photos.caption: Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheers!
Photo of TapHaus49 - Charlotte, NC, United States. Panang Egg with the Spirit Away cocktail.

ORiylwmVL4I3SvgSTf6oRA.text: So I live close by and have been watching this place be built. Excited that they opened yesterday we decided to come today. I asked for a Beer list and they said oh we don't have that but we do have $3.50 16oz taps. I said oh cool what do you have she names some like Miller Lite, PBR, Coors, and Blue Moon. I said ok give me a Blue Moon a couple minutes later she comes back and says sorry we don't have Blue Moon anymore. I guess I could see them running out of beer if it was busy and they weren't called a Tap Haus. I am also confused what Tap Haus sells only domestic beers. I ended up drink water and my partner ended up with a god awful glass of Pinot Grigio and there wasn't even a sorry. We ordered the lobster hush puppies which tasted like sand as an appetizer and a hot chicken sandwich which tasted less than par. I ordered chicken tenders because everything else seemed like I would be taking a risk if I order and what can I say how can you mess up chicken tenders. After the first visit I personally won't be back nor would I recommend it.

PspUdrY159cr8_6jnVqg5A.text: Great establishment! Every time I come here everyone is so welcoming. The staff is very friendly and they offer suggestions. The owner (or manager) personally greets everyone who enters and walks around checking on the customers. Their  customer service is great, especially for a bar. I always get the TapHaus burger and the sweet potato side. It's very good.

14OSwyrIQfXA8qQmb-7IDQ.text: Food was ok. I enjoyed the salmon that came on a piece of cedar. That was something different and the test was very good but i wasn't crazy with the sides and i was told you can not switch out the sides.

33YF8kqRq11ilUX_btM8GA.text: This is appears to be a cute place to grab drinks, when I went with a group of friends it was pretty dead though. Service was below par. One of the people at my table found a hair in her wings and the server failed to acknowledge it at all. More so, the "manager" came to our table asking us what color the hair was, etc. as if the person who found the hair, placed it within her $7 wings and then never offered to replace the food or anything....the mimosas were "okay"...the orange juice tasted really weird, so ask for other flavors. I'm giving two stars because my steak n frites were fine but I wouldn't recommend coming here again, there are way better places you could go.

nZXx6W1m2F4IBC4fWPYmEQ.text: We went here last weekend and the food was fantastic. I got the chicken club sandwich and my husband got the steak sandwich. The fries blew me away, after seeing other reviews I think they may have upped the flavors bc you could definitely taste the rosemary! Very nice staff as well, we had a good time and will return!

IVmifOLD0dTHQGHP8cFWnQ.text: My husband had the hot and jerk wings and an amazing side salad. I had the California grilled chicken sandwich and rosemary fries. We had amazing service from our server Anthony. He was so personable and nice. We will be back time and time again!! A++ we'll be sure to ask for Anthony to be our server he was on point even though I spilled my water.

RqBrduyXe5j7u_bowlJtVQ.text: This place is horrible . Don't bother wasting your money. I ordered the salmon entree. And it came with jasmine rice. They told me they ran out of rice and had to make a new batch . Then my dish came out with rice . The rice was dry and hard like it hadn't been cooked at all. The salmon tasted slimy. My daughter had also ordered a side of rice. It never came out and at the end when it was time to pay the waiter still the rice on the receipt. He didn't even know that her rice never came out. The new batch of rice That was promised was never made. Waiters should know what their customers have ordered and whether they got all their food. My sons chicken fingers were disgusting. Overall, very unsatisfied.

EDwb92IXBETextnZrhwA8Q.text: Upscale bar food with a twist. The apps are delicious. Flatbread pizza, burgers, and chicken sandwich also tasty.  Great spot to watch a game. Nice alternative to run of the mill chains

yqRCEsf9VoNGa1R7aKp7rw.text: Fantastic food. Not your average bar food. People are incredibly nice and make you feel like it is your own neighborhood bar. You must try. I go every Saturday to watch football. A ton of TV's.

NQpsH3oPKXp6DdWm55vSwg.text: We went here for an early dinner on a Sunday.  There were plenty of places to watch the game and it had a good game day atmosphere.  I ordered the basic burger.  It was fantastic.  This is the first place that I've been in months that has actually cooked my burger medium.  As great as the burger was, I was super satisfied with the Brussels sprouts as a side.  They were amazing.  My companion had the fries, and they were also good, but the shoestring variety.  That isn't a knock on the fries, it's just my personal preference is for the steak fry variety.  The service was good and beer selection varied.  We will definitely be back!

SeqwUu3sIjQmt5I9tpY7VA.text: Fun atmosphere with good TVs to watch the games on. The new decor is very well done. Portions are on the small side in relation to the prices. Nashville hot chicken sandwich was really good, but the grilled chicken sandwiches were over cooked and very dry. Also fairly small piece of chicken for the cost.

glDqdsERokZ579Z9APMuxg.text: Bartender was really nice. Great NC and SC beer. The food was lacking and drinks were a little pricey.

1K4Qos5G0dtRyAu3NfWeOA.text: Went for dinner on a Sunday around 4:40 p.m.  We sat in the bar area at a table.  The bartender was not that busy, as there were 4 people at the bar.  He poured our drinks and left them sitting on the bar for the waitress to come while he walked around the bar singing to the music.  We received our drinks 10 minutes later.  Our waitress appeared extremely busy as she would run into the restaurant and then disappear into the kitchen for awhile.  There appeared to be one bartender, one cook (we could see into the kitchen) and two waitresses.  The place was not busy.  I would hate to see them on a really busy day, yikes.  Our food was cold.  We ordered regular fries and our orders came out with lemon oregano seasoning.  We all ordered sandwiches and they were also cold.  The "herb roasted turkey" panini sounded delicious on the menu, but was actually deli turkey with toppings.  So yes, we have had better and won't be back.

mN962uABX1jbE_aVpNuTxA.text: Stopped in for a quick dinner, and to be honest, didn't know what to expect. We started with the Pimento Cheese Fritters, and they were amazing. Followed by house salads(which were very fresh) and wings(the Jerk were our favorite). Great service and atmosphere as well. Will most definitely be back!

gne07PLrKCuScpfAdHlN6g.text: The place is clean and all waitresses are attentive. Had a good time and will come back more often

bWt2qO_w-dBG4fmA2hw3DA.text: Our visit started out well. Friendly staff, greeted and seated quickly. Great for watching football or other sports. We ordered some wings and the pretzels for appetizers. And ordered our meals. It took an incredible amount of time to receive our appetizers and when they finally made it, there was a large black hair in the pretzel appetizer. Obviously accidents happen. But we were surprised there was no reduction in price considering we had to wait for a new appetizer to come out and then basically received it with our meals. Biggest pet peeve. Why order an appetizer if it's just going to come out with the meals? Once the appetizer was correct it was good. However, all four of our meals were subpar at best. Just lots of missteps. I had the fig and prosciutto flatbread and it was just drenched in balsamic. Balsamic is one of those things that are delicious but not to be overdone. After completing our meals we waited awhile for our waitress to return and we finally had to flag down a passing staff member to get our check. I think this place has potential but really needs some help.
